summary: The 'Bringing Executive Accountability, Clarity, and Oversight Now Act' (BEACON Act) amends the Inspector General Act of 1978 to establish an Office of Inspector General within the Executive Office of the President. The bill outlines the Inspector General's powers, including the ability to conduct audits, investigations, and issue subpoenas, with some limitations related to national security matters. It specifies reporting requirements to Congress and requires an annual audit of the new Inspector General's office. It also mandates evaluations of the Executive Office of the President's classification policies and procedures, along with associated reporting.
